website_summaries.verdict: In general, the Nike Air Epic Speed TR II received praises for the comfort that it offered. The style delighted most of the consumers as well. It was found useful for cross-training and also served as a great everyday walking shoe. Although it was liked by many, some people were not happy with the materials used in the footwear. But in the end, it came highly recommended for its performance and build.
pros: A majority of consumers found the Nike Air Epic Speed TR II light and comfortable
Many people appreciated the aesthetics of this shoe
Fitness aficionados claimed that it was good for cross-training as it offered sufficient lateral support
Several people liked that it served well as an everyday walking or work footwear
Some users stated that it delivered an agreeable fit
cons: A couple of reviewers mentioned that the toe box of the Nike Air Epic Speed TR II was narrow
The shoe lacked arch support, as stated by a few buyers
A small number of people complained that the outsole was not properly glued and that it made a cracking sound when used

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for arch support these are not the shoes for you
customer_reviews.text: Took em' out of the box & subjected them to the worst punishment they're going to get from me, a leg workout. (Squats, deadlifts, lunges etc) First thing I noticed was the minimal arch support. (Not an issue for me but obviously worth mentioning.) Almost as though the outer edge of the shoe (think pinky toe down to edge of outer heal) was elevated. Regardless the shoes were comfortable whilst training. By the end of the workout the shoes had definitely broken in and the seemingly elevated outer edge was much less noticeable. Not sure if I would wear these every leg workout but they are worth keeping in my rotation.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: and I nearly loved them. They are super stable with the chunky ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use these for CrossFit workouts, and I nearly loved them. They are super stable with the chunky heel, but also super soft, so I don't want to commit to using these for weightlifting, etc. I also didn't have a lot of confidence they would do rope climbs well with the smooth mid sole. I picked up some Reebok ROS Workout TR's instead, and I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Synapse

customer_reviews.title: Fit and comfort I really do recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great fit super lightweight and very well made I love them! Good support im a big time walker and my feet feel great after every walk and I have put over 35 miles on them and still as good as new so far. I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They would be great, except ...
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is a bit on the small size ... I wear 7.5 and this shoe feels like it's a 7 or 7.25. Funny, I have two other pairs of Nike sneakers (the Air model) and they fit perfectly. I've also used Nike golf shoes and they always fit perfectly. Perhaps I'm a victim of a pair that was created slightly undersized ... I don't know, I donated them to a charity because I couldn't wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard T. Lee

customer_reviews.title: RUN VERY SMALL AND TOO SLIM  VERY HARD LEATHER
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers I bought a 10 my size and they did not fit me. They run to small like I'm a 10 and it runs like it were to be a size 9 1/2. they are hard leather and not to flex. I loved the way they look but could not fit them. Good luck all of yous with these.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Fit different than most Nike shoes
customer_reviews.text: They were a gift for my son. He said at first they were not very comfortable. As he wore them that seemed to improve. He was still not satisfied after he found out the price of them. I was disappointed because after Christmas they were selling for half of what I paid for them. I paid $88. Wont make the same mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy
customer_reviews.text: These are sized correctly but offer no support in the side walls.
customer_reviews.author: DEAN W FULLER

customer_reviews.title: Great success (Borat voice)
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. A full week of P90x3 (in home workout program) A lot of jumping, running in place, push-ups, kicks, jumping jacks, etc. very comfortable and seem to have the support they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoe, Nike delivers as usual
customer_reviews.text: Had these about a week. They're very comfortable, light, and thin. The perfect summer shoe for me. Only issue is they seem to have a smaller width than Nikes typically provides me. This doesn't effect comfort by any means, I'm just visually aware of it by how it flexes when i step.
customer_reviews.author: meggo2206

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. They're super comfortable, super light, great for gym and personal use. Price wasn't bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye Nike
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are terrible!! Unconfirtable and soles are hard... last Nike’s I buy, their shoes are terrible, made in China, and their business relationships and values = bye bye Nike

customer_reviews.title: Ended up returning these shoes - were horribly uncomfortable in the heel
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning these shoes - were horribly uncomfortable in the heel. Love the look and fit as expected, but couldn't deal with the pain they caused in my heel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product

customer_reviews.title: great quality, great price

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Feel - yikes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes hurt my feet and were felt hard on the arch. I have had other Nike shoes that felt awesome. Good luck if you decide to purchase.

customer_reviews.title: That the sneakers fix and the color is correct to picture of item.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, hurt feet

customer_reviews.title: Good looking

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend bought these shoes and ended up returning due to unexpected fit. I could tell when he tried them on they were super narrow, they bulged and pocketed awkwardly. They also seemed a bit more plastic-y than other nikes he’s owned. The colors were vibrant and cool though!

customer_reviews.title: If there's any special please let me know

customer_reviews.text: They were actually decent looking and thought I would end up really liking them but wore them around the house and something just wasnt right.

product_meta.title: Nike mens 852456 Air Epic Speed Tr Ii 6 UK
feature_bullets: Skins are placed at the toe tip for durability and abrasion protection during intense training
Strategic perforations on the heel enhance ventilation
Full-length injected Phylon foam provides lightweight cushioning and responsiveness
Strategically placed rubber pods provide multi-surface traction ideal for speed drills
